intro: Strobilanthes zwickeyae, commonly known as the Zwickey's flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, such as certain species of bees and flies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
